abstract.t: This document describes the Internet Security Label (ISL). ISL provides a mechanism for encoding security (sensitivity) parameters. The ISL is intended to be a layer-independent security mechanism. It can be used with all current versions of the Internet Protocol (IP), including IPv4 and IPv6 as well as the IP Security Protocols (IPSEC), the encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) and the Authentication Header (AH). Other protocols which use a security label can also use the ISL encoding standard including IPX.
